body.p:
Auditors Office Ky.
Frankfort Aug 11th 1863
To His Excellency
J F Robinson.
Dear Sir

Frank Catron the Sheriff of Knox Co for 1861 has paid the revenue in full for that year, and I recommend that you remit the damages incurred by him for a failure to pay at the time required by law. Knox County has been overrun by both armies since the commencement of the War. and it is no fault of Mr Catron that the revenue was not collected and paid at the time required, for he made every exertion that a man could to get it, as the best evidence before me shows. I therefore think his case one in which you can properly exercise the pardoning power and I hope ^you^ will do it.

Franklin Cir Ct
$396.94
Damages remitted
J F Robinson
Frank Catron
Shff of Knox
Issd Aug 11. 1863
